Is 'abundance' the new watchword of US Democrats?
description: Born in California, the concept of 'abundance' has captivated the centrist wing of the Democratic Party. It advocates for an interventionist state paired with deregulation to facilitate investment and increase the supply of essential goods such as housing, energy, transportation and healthcare.

Nigerian air force kills 35 militants in strikes near Cameroon border
description: Nigeria's military said Saturday its air force carried out precision strikes that killed more than 35 jihadist fighters massed near the Cameroon frontier, as the army faces a renewed wave of Boko Haram and ISWAP attacks in the northeast.

headline: Global South: Trump is playing into China's hands
description: The erratic tariff policy pursued by the US president and his administration has so far mainly served to strengthen ties between countries in the Global South with Beijing, and, where relevant, Moscow.

headline: Baidu, China's robotaxi leader, sets sights on Europe
description: The Chinese tech giant, in partnership with American company Lyft, aims to launch driverless ride-hailing services in Germany and the United Kingdom in 2026. While China and the US are driving the robotaxi revolution, Europe remains a bystander.

headline: Is French rap still political?
description: Far from the politically engaged artists of the 1990s, today's top rappers have built their success on largely depoliticized lyrics. Yet, through their stories, both established stars and amateur rappers still convey a strong sense of social engagement.

description: 'Letters from America' (6/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams envies the great American author's bohemian, technology-free existence, despite the chaos it represented.

headline: In 'Kolkhoze,' Emmanuel Carr√®re becomes his mother's son
description: In his new book, the French author reflects on his often tumultuous relationship with his late mother, H√©l√®ne Carr√®re d'Encausse, and explores what he owes her. This major work addresses themes of death, love and writing.

headline: How the 2024 Olympics transformed Greater Paris into a supersized stadium
description: Previously unpublished data on visitor numbers in Paris and its suburbs during the 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games reveal how the city and its residents adapted, and how the Games accelerated Paris's transformation.
